title: Question in regards to installing windows please help.

forumNotes.author: Junior C Hall
forumNotes.content: I have a laptop that has no cd rom drive at all and I have no flash drive or usb stick or anything. My question is this. Can I use say parition magic and cut 5gb or so into a secondary parition and host the windows installion files on that parition and boot that parition to reinstall windows on the main parition? This laptop is using windows vista I am wanting to install windows 8 via a secondary parition on the hard drive. Is this possible? The windows 8 installion I have does boot and even has a auto run but am I really able to boot to the secondary parition and install windows 8 over the vista installion?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
I don't quite understand what you have in your possession and what you want to achieve? Do you want to clean install of Win8 and lose all your data on your Vista partition?  
Do you have the Windows 8 install ISO or what is this 'Windows 8 installation' and how do you know it 'does boot' - boot from what?  

I would recommend you go out and buy a 4GB USB Flash stick for $4 and copy the Windows 8 setup files to it and then boot from it. That way if anything goes wrong you will be able to recover and re-install.

forumNotes.author: Junior C Hall
forumNotes.content: The general idea is this. I want to fully reformat parition and install windows 8 over it. What I am asking is can I make a bootable partition much like a recovery partition and just place the files that is on the windows 8 installion disk onto that partition and boot to it and install windows 8 over vista using that method. Sorta like what dell does with a recovery boot just a windows 8 installion rather then a recovery. Btw yes I want to remove all data on that vista partition.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: So you have a win8 installation DVD?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Assuming you have a WIn8 install DVD..
1. Boot to Vista and make your new empty primary partition (Vista Disk Manager can shrink/extend ptns) - best to have it near the end (e.g. VISTA+dummy partition+4GB NTFS) 2. Copy the contents of the Win8 DVD to the new 4GB partition 3. Install grub4dos onto the hard disk MBR (you can do this easily by downloading RMPrepUSB, hit Ctrl+F5 and then click on the **Install grub4dos** button - hit Enter when prompted to copy over the grldr file) 4. Copy the C:grldr file to the new partition as well 5. Reboot the computer - it will leave you at the grub4dos command prompt 6. Now type **find** to see what partitions you have - we need to boot from the 4GB partition - let us assume this is (hd0,3) (the 4th primary partition) 7. at the grub4dos prompt, type **root (hd0,3) chainloader /bootmgr boot** 8. This should now boot to the Win 8 installer - enter the product key and choose Custom install - delete the other partitions (not the 4GB one!) and tell it to install to the empty space (you may need to create a new partition first?). 9. At some point BEFORE the install actually starts, hit the **SHIFT+F10** keys to get to a Win8 command prompt. Then type **bootsect /nt60 ALL /mbr** - this will replace the grub4dos bootloader with the normal bootmgr bootloader. Type **exit** and proceed with the install. P.S. Alternative is to skip step 9 and leave the grub4dos bootloader on. In that case make a menu.lst file like this: D:menu.lst (on 4GB partition) **timeout 3** **default 0** **title Boot Windows 8** **root (hd0,0)** **chainloader /bootmgr** **title Boot Win8 Setup/Repair** **root (hd0,1)** **chainloader /bootmgr**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
> What I mean is in your post you said Alternative is to skip 9 and make a menu list. When windows 8 is fully installed on the new partition and is working will I be able to use the win 8 dos prompt or will grub4dos completely override it?  
If you have a menu.lst file and skip step 9, then you can boot to either Win8 or the 4GB WIn8 Setup ptn via grub4dos menu. If you need to change the menu, you can press c and enter the grub4dos shell and then manually type in your commands...

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
> That I am unsure of as well. Should I after created the new partition and after all files are copied over including the grub4dos files reboot before I create a menu list and use the find command or should I add the menu list first?  
If you skip step 9, then when you reboot it will boot to grub4dos - if there is no menu.lst then you will have to type in the commands manually, if you do have a menu.lst then you can use that. If the menu.lst does not work, just hit **c** to get to the grub4dos command shell and type in the commands manually.  

P.S. that is why I, personally, prefer to install grub4dos. You get a command shell in case anything goes wrong. With EasyBcd you just have to hope it will boot to something on the next reboot...

forumNotes.author: Junior C Hall
forumNotes.content: Ok I just wanted to make sure that the grub4dos does not remove the actual win 8 dos it self.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
grub4dos is a bootloader. Once installed on the Master Boot Record, it will always boot to grub4dos first. From grub4dos you can choose to boot to any partition. For instance, instead of using chainloader /bootmgr for the first Win8 partition, you could just tell grub4dos to load the partition boot code instead  

title Boot from first partition (which should contain a bootloader that loads bootmgr that loads Win8)  
root (hd0,0)  
chainloader (hd0,0)
